name: Norfolk Island
introduction: Two British attempts at establishing the island as a penal colony (1788-1814 and 1825-55) were ultimately abandoned. In 1856, the island was resettled by Pitcairn Islanders, descendants of the Bounty mutineers and their Tahitian companions.

communications.phone_system_international: country code - 672; submarine cable links with Australia and New Zealand; satellite earth station - 1
communications.broadcast_media: 1 local radio station; broadcasts of several Australian radio and TV stations available via satellite (2009)

economy.overview: Norfolk Island is suffering from a severe economic downturn. Tourism, the primary economic activity, is the main driver of economic growth. The agricultural sector has become self-sufficient in the production of beef, poultry, and eggs.
economy.agriculture_products: Norfolk Island pine seed, Kentia palm seed, cereals, vegetables, fruit; cattle, poultry
economy.industries: tourism, light industry, ready mixed concrete
economy.exports_commodities: postage stamps, seeds of the Norfolk Island pine and Kentia palm, small quantities of avocados

geography.location_description: Oceania, island in the South Pacific Ocean, east of Australia
geography.area_note: about 0.2 times the size of Washington, DC
geography.climate: subtropical; mild, little seasonal temperature variation
geography.terrain: volcanic island with mostly rolling plains
geography.notes: most of the 32 km coastline consists of almost inaccessible cliffs, but the land slopes down to the sea in one small southern area on Sydney Bay, where the capital of Kingston is situated

government.name: Territory of Norfolk Island
government.name_etymology: named by British explorer Captain James COOK after Mary HOWARD, Duchess of Norfolk, in 1774
government.dependency_status: self-governing territory of Australia; administered from Canberra by the Department of Regional Australia, Local Government, Arts and Sport
government.government_type: parliamentary democracy (formerly the Legislative Assembly); overseas territory of Australia; note - in May 2015, the Australian Parliament passed the Norfolk Island Legislation Amendment Bill 2015 which abolished Norfolk Island self-government and replaced it with an interim Advisory Council effective 1 July 2015
government.capital_time_zone: UTC+11 (16 hours ahead of Washington, DC, during Standard Time)
government.national_holiday: Bounty Day (commemorates the arrival of Pitcairn Islanders), 8 June (1856)
government.constitution: previous 1913, 1957; latest effective 7 August 1979; amended many times, last in 2015 (2016)
government.legal_system: English common law and the laws of Australia
government.executive_chief_of_state: Queen ELIZABETH II (since 6 February 1952); represented by the Australian governor general
government.executive_cabinet: Executive Council consists of 4 Legislative Assembly members
government.executive_elections: the monarchy is hereditary; governor general appointed by the monarch; administrator appointed by the governor general of Australia for a 2-year term and represents the monarch and Australia
government.legislative_description: unicameral Norfolk Island Regional Council (5 seats; members directly elected by simple majority vote to serve 4-year terms)
government.legislative_elections: elections last held 28 May 2016; next to be held 2020
government.legislative_highest_courts: Supreme Court of Norfolk Island (consists of the chief justice and several justices); note - appeals beyond the Supreme Court of Norfolk Island are heard by the Federal Court and the High Court of Australia
government.legislative_judge_selection: justices appointed by the governor general of Australia from among justices of the Federal Court of Australia; justices serve until mandatory retirement at age 70
government.legislative_subordinate_courts: Petty Court of Sessions; specialized courts including a Coroner's Court and the Employment Tribunal
government.political_parties: Norfolk Island Labor Party [Mike KELLY] ++ Norfolk Liberals [John BROWN]
government.flag_description: three vertical bands of green (hoist side), white, and green with a large green Norfolk Island pine tree centered in the slightly wider white band; green stands for the rich vegetation on the island, and the pine tree - endemic to the island - is a symbol of Norfolk Island
